text:
PUMA PRESENTATIONS from the
ItHUlU UNIVERSITY OF KENTUCKY
In Lexington
For September 1946
PROGRAM OF THE MONTH
WE THINK SO. WHAS, Sundays at 10:00 a.m.
A round table on current events with a “differ¬
ent” slant, moderated by Margaret Harrison
McDowell.
Over WHAS, Louisville
(50,000 W., 840 kilocycles)
Mondays through Saturdays at 12:45 p.m.
Farm Programs. (The Wednesday program is de¬
voted to farm news, and the Saturday program is for
homemakers, prepared by Miss Orinne Johnson,
Agricultural Experiment Station)
Saturdays, 1:30 p.m.
“Operations—Music’’ (Musical quiz program)
Saturdays, 1:45 p.m.
“These Lived,” a series of dramatizations of the lives
of men and women, important in their day.
Sundays, 10:00 a.m.
“We Think So,” a round table moderated by Mar¬
garet Harrison McDowell.
Over WBKY, Lexington
(The University of Kentucky’s Frequency Modulation
Station—500 W., 42,900 kilocycles)
Mondays
7:00 p.m. Round Table on Current Events
7:30 p.m. “Americana Moods”
7:45 p.m. News
8:00 p.m. “From the Carnegie Room” (Classical
Recordings)
8:45 p.m. “Tempos in Pastelle” with Jack Feiera-
bend, pianist
Wednesdays
7:00 p.m. “From Pills to Penicillin”
7:15 p.m. “Books and Authors”
7:30 p.m. “Relax with Music”
7:45 p.m. News
8:00 p.m. “The Symphony Hour”
#Also broadcast over WLAP, Lexington
(250 W., 1450 kilocycles)
(over)
